Event: Russia brokered a ceasefire after the last war in the region in 2020, in which Azerbaijan regained control of swathes of territory in Nagorno-Karabakh and the surrounding regions.
Azerbaijan launched an offensive after the separatist authority reported a major escalation of hostilities in Azerbaijan's Nagorno-Karabakh region.
Thousands of Armenians gathered at the airport in Nagorno-Karabakh after separatist forces agreed to a ceasefire with Azerbaijan.
Armenia's Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan said that Armenia needs to be 'free of conflict' for the sake of its independence, after the fall of Nagorno-Karabakh.
The ethnic Armenian leadership of breakaway Nagorno-Karabakh said that the terms of their ceasefire with Azerbaijan were being implemented.
Petya Grigoryan fled Nagorno-Karabakh due to the Azerbaijani military offensive and recounted the bombing and civilian casualties.
Russia delivered more than 50 tonnes of food and other aid to Nagorno-Karabakh.
Four ex-leaders of Nagorno-Karabakh were detained by Azerbaijan, while three others reached Armenia.
